subject: science
learning_outcomes: Identify characteristics of living and non-living things
Describe basic needs and life processes of plants and animals
Observe and describe properties of common materials (wood, metal, cloth, plastic)
Carry out simple investigations using basic science skills (observe, record, predict)
Understand simple weather patterns and seasons relevant to the local environment
Recognise the importance of cleanliness, health and hygiene for humans
Explore basic concepts of force and motion through everyday activities
topics: Living and non-living things: plants and animals, their needs
Materials and their uses: physical properties and sorting
Health and hygiene: clean water, handwashing, basic disease prevention
Environment and seasons: local weather, effects on daily life
Simple investigations: asking questions, observing, recording results
Forces and motion: pushes and pulls in familiar contexts
